jblowe77 wrote:

>
> Hello, I'm a newbie to Heritrix.
>
> Would like to do some shallow focussed crawling of a few sites
> (looking for candidates for further analysis).
>
> So:
>
> - Want to *not* download all the images n stuff...just text (html)

See this blog entry of Tom Emerson's: 
http://www.dreamersrealm.net/~tree/blog/?s=text%2Fhtml&submit=GO

> - Would like to test to see whether any of a certain small list of
> words occurs on a page before actually saving it.

There is no out-of-the-box facility to help you do this.  You'll have to 
write your own processor to parse out text to run your word-check against.

>
> Can Heritrix do this out-of-the-box? (seems like it should).
>
> But when I try to set a pre-processor URIregexp filter to return
> "false" for the pattern "jpg" I still get files whose URI matches "jpg".
>
> What am I doing wrong, please?  Also, suggestions on setting a filter
> to look for the listed words appreciated.
>
You're probably doing nothing wrong.  Our filters as-is are 
self-admitted non intuitive (See '6.1.1.1. Problems with the current 
Scopes' of the user manual).  A new filter model was recently added.  If 
the Tom Emerson blog entry doesn't get you what you need, I'd suggest 
you try the new (experimental) DecidingScope and DecidingFilters (See 
decidingscope in the user manual to get started).

> Great project, this Heritrix, BTW!

Thank you for the kind words,
Yours,
St.Ack
